info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 1:21PM MST until December 17 at 3:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 3 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THURSDAY TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches at lower elevations, and up to 6 inches in the mountains. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM Thursday to 3 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM Thursday to 5 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will also reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
